text.section: The Board may require as a condition to issuance of a wetlands license that compensation be made to the State, of a kind and in an amount deemed appropriate by the Board.

section.section: The Board shall establish a compensation rate for cables, pipelines, or similar structures in accordance with this subsection.

The minimum compensation rate:
Is $2.50 per linear foot per year for cables, pipelines, or similar structures;
Applies to each individual cable, pipeline, or similar structure; and
Applies to all new and existing authorizations beginning July 2, 2012.

The Board may:
Increase the compensation rate as considered appropriate; and
Adjust the compensation rate to reflect changes in the Consumer Price Index as published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the U.S. Department of Labor or by an appropriate method selected by the Board.

text.section: Monetary compensation received by the State in conjunction with a wetlands license may not be applied to the State Annuity Bond Fund Account.

section.section: There is created a special fund, known as the Tidal Wetlands Compensation Fund.

The following money shall be deposited in the Tidal Wetlands Compensation Fund:
Any monetary payment by a licensee in lieu of creating, restoring, or enhancing tidal wetlands that is required by the Department or the Board as a condition of a permit or license;
Any penalty imposed by a court in accordance with this title; and
Any penalty imposed by the Department under this title.

text.section:
Funds credited and any interest accrued to the Fund:
Shall remain available until expended; and
May not revert to the General Fund under any other provision of law.

All monetary compensation paid to the State in conjunction with a wetlands license other than that specified under subsection (d)(2) of this section shall be deposited in the Wetlands and Waterways Program Fund established under § 5-203.1 of this article.
